meanings.definition: The quality of being easily influenced or affected by others.
meanings.sent1: Her impressibility made her believe everything she heard.
meanings.sent2: His impressibility was evident when he teared up at the touching movie scene.
meanings.sent3: The impressibility of the puppy to learn new tricks was quite endearing.
meanings.sent4: The child's impressibility was like a sponge soaking up all the information around him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used the student's impressibility to inspire a love for learning.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily impressed or moved emotionally.
meanings.sent1: The beauty of the sunset left a lasting impressibility on her heart.
meanings.sent2: His impressibility towards art made him a great admirer of paintings.
meanings.sent3: The impressibility of the toddler towards bubbles brought joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The music had an impressibility that resonated deeply within the audience.
meanings.sent5: The novel's impressibility on the reader's mind lingered long after the last page.
